title: Ezreal has 53% winrate and 70% pickrate in Diamond+
body: Are we going to see any changes anytime soon? He is beyond completely ridiculous right now.

To only have a 53% win rate in diamond and above actually doesn't make him sound that bad to me. If he had a 53% win rate in general, and 55+% in diamond and above, then I would start to worry. 

Perhaps I'm just misinformed about what win rates look like in diamond for broken champs.

> [{quoted}](name=CyanoPirate,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=b0xXTijd,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-02-05T22:37:38.852+0000)

> 
> Perhaps I'm just misinformed about what win rates look like in diamond for broken champs.

But when pick rates reach these numbers, a standard high win rate is insane. He is being picked into 50%+ of games in the highest tier, which means he's basically being picked completely independently of whatever the rest of your team is, and yet he's winning significantly more than half of the games he's played in (in terms of win rate, the difference between 50% and 53% is major).

He's picked into every possible enemy team comp, with every possible type of teammate, and yet his stats aren't suffering for it at all. Generalist champions are fine but they're balanced around the fact that they won't perform as well as a specialist in any particular role - that's not the case with Ezreal. You can pick him into an AOE wombo combo team and he'll perform as well as MF would, while performing better in every other role.

Every high ELO bot lane is Ezreal vs Lucian. I have never seen less diversity in a role than now.

The main issue is that he has such an exceptional pick rate. He is far and away the most popular champion in League right now, and with such an enormous pool of games played on him, having a 53% winrate is exceptionally high. Something is wrong with his state of balance to cause such an unbelievably high pick rate with a very solid/great winrate in a division which is generally above non-meta picks.

I guess. To me, if he were really OP, there is no way that he would have a great pick rate because he would draw bans. It sounds like he's the best adc that isn't banned, so he's probably slightly op. It's just that everyone good enough to play in diamond knows that and is using that slight advantage. 

The "slightly" op mentality is corroborated by the 53% win rate. Really not that high.

Now, I agree he needs nerfs, because the situation is unhealthy to be sure. I just think it's important to get the rhetoric right. "Beyond ridiculous" seems exaggerated for the situation. "Good enough to be crowding out other choices" is more accurate.
